column4: is there noone who knows how to set up xorg to use a tv as a secondary screen??
doesn't look like it... although I don't think you need a virt refresh... depends on type of TV I guess though...

its a old philips.. i had to call philips help center to get the refresh rate and max resolution, and she never heard about vertical refresh rate... but should i just skip the vertical refressh rate line in xorg config?
comment it out for that monitor... see if it works...
they use the same backends... k3b is just an interface for that... gnomebaker is very simular
and would fit into a gnome desktop a lot better
ok, i didnt know that.. :) is gnomebaker as easy to use, and can burn images? i tried toaster once but it was reall crappy i thought...
it is described on its site as: 'a k3b clone for gnome' ... its interface is very simular
ok ill try it :) sounds nice...
its basic interface: http://gnomebaker.sourceforge.net/wp-content/gnomebaker1.png is pretty much the same...
are there anything similar to quanta for gnome too? other that bluefish then, ause that was nasty...
apparently nvu ... but I've not tried that myself
I don't really do web developement much... and what I do do, vi is fine
ok. but what do you do then since you use vi?
I type
LOL! Is it really true?? :o hehe, no i ment what programming language do you use if any?
heh... just basic HTML, CSS, and trying unsuccessfully to not suck at XHTML
ok :) i guess vi has syntax highlighting then? i need it cause im writing PHP...
gedit does ... not required here though
also, so does nvu... it is basically mozilla composer, but without having to load the rest of Mozilla to use it...

webtoe, ups: i have fell in love for the quanta, it has a nice syntax highlighting, autoclosure of tags, and some other stuff, the only bad thing is its made for KDE... but ive tested nvu and bluefish and some others too, but i dont like them as good as quanta..
thats cool... just... quanta takes a year to run when you're using GNOME   :/
another thing btw, do you know how to set the size of the icons? i found it a couple days ago but i formatted so now i dont find it anymore :s
